result.execSummary:
The defendant Joni Hendricksen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  

AODA and follow through.

records.addlTxt: cc ADA Kerri Puig
cc ADA Kerri Puig
to Judge Jacobson from J.H.; cc ADA Kerri Puig
Sentencing Hearing on Oct. 7, 2015 before Judge Jacobson
Letters of character
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:06 pm 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Erik Mcfarland.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent - Heroin (>3-10g)/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
Ct. 2 (Possession of THC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Amended Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent - Heroin (>3-10g))>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Mcfarland makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 3 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 2 years ES - CONDITIONS OF ES: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA and follow through; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week, or if not, perform 10 hours of CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def is eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 341 days sentence credit. 
COURT remands def to sheriff for transport to WI State Prison System. 

Adj: 2:22 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-07-2015 02:00 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-27-2015 09:45 am
Status conference on June 23, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on May 22, 2015 at 09:45 am.

(AMENDED).  $5000.00 signature bond with first $1000.00 in cash.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - Day Report if bond is posted.  Absolute sobriety.  No contact with victim(s):  D.V.    Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
